Charlotte Tilbury blushes are by far my favourite powder blush texture. They don’t look too powdery or too shimmery on the face. But they are very illuminating. This colour Love is the drug is the one I wear the least. It’s the darkest one I own. I use it for evening or if I’m looking washed out. It’s more pigmented than my others so I recommend using a blush brush with softer bristles and a light hand to apply.

review_title: CHEAP packaging for what you pay for.
review_content:
I adore the color and formula. It’s light, but buildable. Seriously just a flattering color I imagine for every skin tone. It really is just a beautiful little flush of color. BUT. Holy Christ Charlotte! Could you have been any cheaper with the packaging. For the price I expected there to be some weight to the product. I wanted to feel like I was holding something expensive. It’s cheap feeling. But the product and formula are beautiful. I just wish it felt like what you paid for as far as packaging goes. I did keep it, though. Just because I like what’s in the pan.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: This is the perfect everyday peachy pink blush without being too pink. It gives a pretty, natural luminosity without being too radiant. I got this a few months ago, use it daily, and have not yet seen the on coming through.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
This blush is amazing. I have Love Glow and Pillow Talk and let me just say that Sephora’s product image for both colors is way off, pillow talk is much darker almost brown, and love glow is pinker! At first I hated the color Pillow talk, loved the formula because it’s smooth & silky and blends like a dream. But the color really looked awful on my fair complexion. It looked orangey-brown. I recently decided to give it another try using a MAC 133 brush, swirling it around the darker shade and then lightly applying to my cheekbones in small circular blending motions. Then I went over it with the middle shade and the result is a beautiful natural flush! Not brown or orange at all. Love Glow has been my go-to blush ever since I got it. It is peachy-pink and gives a very pretty peachy-pink flush. Its nicely pigmented and buildable, it goes on smoothly and blends like a dream. I don’t think the packaging it cheap it all, it comes in a mirrored compact. I have not had any issues with breakage and have dropped Love Glow several times. I’d like to purchase more colors but need to see them in person because the product photos are really off.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: For Love is the drug. This is a long lasting beautiful finish and colour. It is soft and picks up product easily and crumbles with the wrong brush. Use a true blush brush for a good result.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
Lordy!! CT products are so over hyped and a complete disappointment. From the tacky and cheap packaging to the low quality formulations and inflated price tag, I honestly don't understand reviews that state these are the best products ever. Love Is The Drug cost me $50 CAD and was returned the next day. The lighter pink color texture resembles chalk, applies unevenly and last for about an hour. The smaller brighter pink color is exactly the same. The two colors do not provide a fresh look, What you end up with is dry/matte looking cheekbones with a smudge of pink on the apples. The amount of actual product in the pan is laughable for the price. One of the worst blush products I have ever used, and I've purchased a lot of blush in my time.. Save your money. This blush is garbage. Talk about the influence of celebrity endorsements, that is the only thing this product has going for it.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Deep', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I'm a late-40's CoverFXN70, and I've been looking for a pink blush that works for me. I've tried MANY, and either none have worked, or they've got Boron Nitride in them, which makes for a beautiful luminous blush, but my skin seriously reacts to Boron Nitride. These blushes don't have Boron Nitride = yay! - I was concerned that with the talc it'd be chalky on me, but it's not chalky at all on me. - I was concerned that it'd be too bright/clownish, but it's not, not at all... I use a light hand and layer, and it really brightens up my face. I love pairing this with Bite Fuschia Frosting. - Finely-milled, doesn't cake on. This is what Temptalia said, and she's absolutely spot-on: "I think what makes this different from your standard gold-shimmered pink blushes is that the pink is rather cool-toned, which may make it more flattering on those with cooler complexions who have tried the warmer options and found them lacking. It had excellent color payoff with a soft, smooth texture that wasn’t powdery. The color applied evenly to the skin and blended out well without trouble."
…read more

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: Gorgeous packaging! Unfortunately, I see no colour payoff with the blush and I am pretty fair. Sadly this will be returned and I'll try a different shade.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Age 45-54', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I spend alot of money on makeup. I'm a complete makeup junkie. I love CT cosmetics. This blush looks stunning in the pan, but it crumbles way too easily for $40. It's a nice blush and applies nicely, but it's just not really impressive visually on the face. At that price point, I don't want my cosmetics to crumble for no reason either. I bought two separate colors, and it happened to both. The compacts didn't break like many other reviewers stated happened to them, but just the fact that we have this many issues with this blush shows there's a major problem in both the product and the packaging. It really needs an overhaul to compare with the extremely high quality products that CT is known for! I'm still going to buy her line of cosmetics, because these blushes were the only ones that I've ever had a problem with, all her other products that I've tried are outstanding, especially her lipsticks! I can't say I'd recommend this blush, unfortunately.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I’ve been in a rut with my blushes, always grabbing the same ones. I wanted something with a newer formula that didn’t emphasize pores but still had a great texture and soft sheen. Love is the drug is a beautiful pink color on my medium neutral slightly olive skin that matches with everything. It’s a great color to pop on when in a rush and you don’t have time to think twice about putting a look together so you need something universally flattering. The formula was soft and a little dusty, but such a dream to apply and blend out. I only took off one star because it seemed to fade a bit more than my other high-end blushes around the 9-10 hour mark.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Red', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
So I ordered 4 colors and kept 2. Love drug and sex on fire didn’t show up on me at all and I’m light/medium skin tone depending on the season. I tried to layer them on and I never really saw color pay off. I kept ecstasy and love is the drug as they were brighter in pigment and showed up well. I still had to layer more on than I usually would with a dior blush or hourglass blush. I may try pillow talk as it looks to be bright as well. If you are fair in skin tone the lighter shades may do well for you but I just couldn’t justify keeping them since I’d never use them. The color seems to last well during the day and the shimmer is very flattering. It isn’t a glitter party with huge chunks which is great. For the price, I think I’d go with hourglass before I’d buy another CT blush just because I’ve never been disappointed with hourglass blushes.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Great color and product, packaging not so much
review_content:
I love the color, it's subtle enough yet enough give a little glow. I find NARS orgasm is a little too dark for me. In fact, I swore I wasn't going to use any other highlight after using this. Except the packaging... I removed 1 star because the packaging is horrendous. I haven't taken this blush out and about and only use it at home and keep it in a drawer. Just from daily use, the hinge that connects the top and bottom of the compact is falling apart and now is broken. There are chips randomly on my floor and it's basically broken. I couldn't believe it because I'm a pretty gentle person, and there's a lot of product left and the packaging just broke on its own. Not impressed. Also the compact is so difficult to open and close, that I've left a nail dent in it from struggling to open it.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I am in love with Tilbury blushes. They are so finely milled, and apply so smoothly and evenly, they look like a natural flush on skin. Absolutely beautiful. First Love is a pale peach that is tailor made for fair to light skin as it gives a subtle wash of color that may be too subtle for darker skins, although it is buildable. It is almost impossible to overdo it with this shade.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: This colour is perfect for my medium golden olive skin tone. It's a great wash of colour for spring and everyday wear. It's finely milled and doesnt fade too quickly through out the day. I wesa makeup about six days of the week. And I reach for this about three times a week. The other three days are for other random shades with no consistancy. So I will need a back up of this for sure.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Best blush, lasts all day, youthful glow
review_content: I am blush obsessed. I usually use the cream blushes from glossier. I have blushes from mac, Chanel, etc. However, none of the products I found gave me a natural flush that lasted all day. The product is luxurious and just the right shade of pink for me since I am pale as the moon. Since I am so pale, I often have a blue tint to my skin, this blush gives me a soft youthful glow

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I ordered this product after a review from TurtleCreekLane! I really like the blush! It goes on smoothly and wears well. Be careful with your color choices becuase these are very bright colors. This one is claiming to be pink but its more of a peach! The packaging is beautiful but after reading the reviews, I'm worried about it breaking! So I wouldn't just drop it in your bag!

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Gray', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: I am a huge blush collector, and CT makes one of the best formulas. The color “sex on fire” is a great nudeish pink that goes with any look. This is a blush that you cannot go overboard on, great for someone new to blush or scared of clown face. I also love how compact the packaging is, great for travel.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Strongly pigmented, but with a light had you can achieve a beautiful subtle glow. Tilbury's blushes are my favorite but I took off 2 stars as 1. the high price tag is a little outrageous and 2. it is very fragile! I dropped one, and not a long distance, either and it shattered. Not something you can transport without careful packing (bubble wrap?).

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush

review_content:
The only reason I’m not giving this 5 stars is the price. I am NC 42 for reference. I collect blush like others collect eyeshadow pallettes! This blush is fabulous because it too pigmented to the point I have to remember to watch how much I pick up. It’s also not so muted that I have to keep building to see a nice flush. I’ve always loved the look of shimmery blush, but I could never get it to show up until now! Ecstasy is a gorgeous peachy/pink that gives that fool proof glow! That being said something about the formula fades after 4-5 hours on my skin. The packaging is lux! Be sure not to drop it. Tibury’s powder products are extremely delicate and breaks easily! $40 is a bit pricey but for how easy it is to apply....totally worth it!

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek To Chic Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Gorgeous mauvey blush for brown-skinned ladies!
review_content:
This is a gorgeous blush for just about anyone, but especially for the neutral- and warm-toned ladies in the NC35-NC45 skin tone range. It's highly pigmented, so a little goes a long way! I would compare this to the Tom Ford blushes, but this is more reasonably priced. I own TF blushes, so I can tell that the Charlotte Tilbury ones are an exact dupe. Also keep in mind that C/Tilbury used to create makeup for Tom Ford in its early days. So, I'm not surprised that the TF and C/Tilbury blushes are an exact dupe in terms of quality.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Great everyday product, would buy again
review_content:
It's soft, easily blendable and doesn't cling to any dry spots. It hasn't broken me out or anything like that, and lasts all day long. I love layering the two different shades! There's a bit of shimmer, but not too much, which I prefer in a blush. Just enough to give a bit of a glow but not see actual glitter on the cheeks. I found this shade (Ecstasy) to be perfect for my skin (I'm on the more fair side). Can be worn very subtly or built up for a more dramatic look. The packaging feels very luxe and it's a pleasure to use every day.
